name: silicon production, multi-Si, casted | silicon, multi-Si, casted | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4456/documentation

This dataset represents the production of a multi-crystalline (or polycrystalline) silicon block. The silicon blocks are produced by melting and casting electronic-grade silicon, off-grade silicon and solar-grade silicon into quartz crucibles. This type of silicon is the starting material for the production of crystalline silicon wafers, either for electronic or for photovoltaic applications. This dataset is based on literature data.;References:;Jungbluth N., Stucki M, and Frischknecht R. (2009) Photovoltaics. In Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. ecoinvent report No. 6-XII, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH, 2009.

The activity starts when the raw materials enter the process.

This activity ends with the production of a multi-Si block. The dataset includes the melting and casting of different grades of silicon, the energy consumption, water emissions and estimated infrastructure use.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time of data collection. Data refer to 2005.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Electronic-grade silicon, off-grade silicon and solar-grade silicon are molten and casted or melted into quartz crucibles. The crucibles are afterwards reused in road construction. The large round MC-Si blocks are cut with saws to square blocks. The cuttings can be partly reused. Wafers can be directly produced from these multi-crystalline blocks.;Reference:;Jungbluth N., Stucki M, and Frischknecht R. (2009) Photovoltaics. In Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. ecoinvent report No. 6-XII, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH, 2009.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Extrapolation with cumulative data including wafer sawing for electricity use.

exchanges.description:
The silicon blocks are produced by melting and casting electronic-grade silicon, off-grade silicon and solar-grade silicon into quartz crucibles. This type of silicon is the starting material for the production of crystalline silicon wafers, either for electronic or for photovoltaic applications. 

References:
Jungbluth N., Stucki M, and Frischknecht R. (2009) Photovoltaics. In Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Ökobilanzen für die Schweiz. ecoinvent report No. 6-XII, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH, 2009.

exchanges.description: Literature value (de Wild 2007),  total silicon needed minus internally recycled silicon from ingot cut-offs and broken wafers. The ratio between silicon, electronics grade and silicon, solar grade is based on world production volumes (Jungbluth, 2007, ecoinvent v2 report no.6).
